4: 5. Three-step verification for deposits and withdrawals
4-1: Step One Verification is a simple KYC (Know Your Customer) procedure, which must be done by every user to withdraw. Disregarding the payment choice, the amount of payment, the amount of withdrawing, the choice of withdrawing, and nationality of the user, step one verification must be done before any withdrawal or transaction to another user can be made. The following information must be provided: first name, last name, date of birth, country of usual residence, gender, and full address.
4-3: Every user who deposits cryptocurrency equal to $2,000 (two thousand dollars) and more, withdraws cryptocurrency equal to $2,000 (two thousand dollars) and more, or transfers to another user cryptocurrency equal to $1,000 (one thousand dollars) and more shall perform Step Two Verification. The withdrawal, tip, or deposit will be stopped until the procedure is completed. Step Two Verification will lead the user to a subpage where they should provide a high-resolution ID photo that clearly shows the face and the identity number. If the data provided for the Step One Verification is correct, there will also be a digital verification performed using two different databanks to ensure the provided information and the document match. The user will be asked to confirm their current residence if the digital verification fails or is impossible to pass. In such a case, a registration certificate issued by the government authority or a similar document will be required.
4-5: Step Three Verification must be done by any user who deposits cryptocurrency equal to $5000 (five thousand dollars) and more, withdraws cryptocurrency equal to $5000 (five thousand dollars) and more, or transfers to another user cryptocurrency equal to $3000 (three thousand dollars) and more. In such cases, the user will be asked for a source of wealth. The withdrawal, tip, or deposit will be stopped until Step Three Verification is completed.
5-0: The formal identification of customers on entry into commercial relations is a vital element both for the regulations relating to money laundering and for the KYC policy. This identification relies on the following fundamental principles: a copy of your passport / ID card / driving license, each shown alongside the identity number. Also, a second photo showing your face is required. You have the right to blur any information with an exception of the date of birth, nationality, gender, first name, second name, and the photo. All four corners of the ID must be visible and all details readable. A Betnomi employee may do additional checks if necessary.
